snippet: JoAnne Carpenter, who received money through the Neediest Cases Fund, coped with bouts of depression and worked part-time jobs while raising two children.
abstract: JoAnne Carpenter of the Bronx, who was profiled in 2003 as part of New York Times Neediest Cases series, graduates from John Jay College of Criminal Justice with honors; Carpenter received aid from Jewish Child Care Assn of New York, social service agency supported by Neediest Cases Fund, allowing her to focus on her studies.
lead_paragraph: JoAnne Carpenter, who received money through the Neediest Cases Fund, coped with bouts of depression and worked part-time jobs while raising two children.

headline.print_headline: Overcoming Years of Hurdles, Woman Fulfills Quest for a John Jay Degree
headline.main: After Years of Struggles, Bronx Woman Earns Her Prize: A Criminal Justice Degree

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
